Module ing.sw.puddu.rios.rizzo
Package it.polimi.ingsw.controller

Interface ControllerInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Client, Controller
    public interface ControllerInterface
    Interface for a controller It is implemented by two classes, Controller and Client Controller actually implements the logic, providing a way to modify the model Client only offers the interface to allow ClientView, the view on the client, to believe it is talking to a real controller. What it actually does is simply forward the method call through our remote method invocation system

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description

      acknowledges that the last generated id has been well received, and prepares to accept the next view and generate the next id
      void deleteId​(int id)
      deletes the view related to an id
      void generateId()
      generates an id in a sequential fashion, and publishes it
      void getNumPlayers()
      prompts the controller to publish the number of players to the observers
      void handleDisconnection()
      takes actions based on the disconnection of a view
      void isGameAvailable()
      asks the controller if there is a game available for the current set of players.
      void kill()
      kills the controller
      void publishAction​(int id, Action action)
      publishes an action taken by a player
      void publishCards​(int id, java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> numCards)
      tells the controller the numbers of the cards chosen by the first players
      void publishVoluntaryEndOfTurn​(int id)
      publishes the intention to voluntarily end the turn
      void requestActions​(int id)
      requests to perform an action the permission is granted automatically when it becomes the requesting client's turn
      void requestAllPlayersConnected()
      prompts the controller to publish a custom message when all players are connected
      void requestCards​(int id)
      requests the list of cards that are allowed for a player
      void requestDeck()
      requests the controller to send the full deck
      void requestToSetupWorker​(int id)
      requests to place a worker on the board the permission is granted automatically when it becomes the requesting client's turn
      void restore​(int id, boolean intentToRestore)
      tells the controller to restore (or not to restore) an existing saved game

      Sets the number of players
      void setupWorker​(int id, SetupAction action)
      places a worker on the board for a given player
      void willRestore()
      publishes info about whether a saved game will be restored or not

        void setName​(int id,
             java.lang.String name)
        requests a name for the player with the given id
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the player for whom to set the name
        name - the chosen name

      • isGameAvailable

        void isGameAvailable()
        asks the controller if there is a game available for the current set of players. The controller will answer through the observer-observable pattern

      • restore

        void restore​(int id,
             boolean intentToRestore)
        tells the controller to restore (or not to restore) an existing saved game
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the commanding view
        intentToRestore - the intention to restore the saved game or not

        Parameters:
        id - the id of the view that is issuing the command
        numCards - the list of the numbers of the cards that were chosen

      • requestCards

        void requestCards​(int id)
           throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        requests the list of cards that are allowed for a player
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the player for whom the list is valid
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the wait of the requester is interrupted

        Parameters:

        numCard - the number of the card the player has chosen

                   throws java.lang.InterruptedException

        Parameters:
        id - the id of the requesting client
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the wait of the requester is interrupted
